str2: From a derivative of laos and ergon; a public servant, i.e. A functionary in the Temple or Gospel, or a worshipper or benefactor.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Set apart by (or for) God, holy, sacred. From hagos; sacred.
True (lit: made of truth), real, genuine. From alethes; truthful.
A tent, booth, tabernacle, abode, dwelling, mansion, habitation. Apparently akin to skeuos and skia; a tent or cloth hut.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To fasten, pitch a tent. A prolonged form of a primary verb; to fix, i.e. to set up.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Lord, master, sir; the Lord. From kuros; supreme in authority, i.e. controller; by implication, Master.
No, not. Also ouk, and ouch a primary word; the absolute negative adverb; no or not.
A man, one of the human race. From aner and ops; man-faced, i.e. A human being.
